newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares ride on non-oil data to end firm.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares ride on non-oil data to end firm.

text.p: Singapore shares rode to a firmer finish on Tuesday on the back of better-than-expected April non-oil domestic exports data, dealers said.

Electronics and blue chips in the banking and property sectors were sought after and could extend gains if there were no nasty surprises from the U.S. Federal Reserve meeting later in the day, the dealers said.
The Straits Times Industrials Index closed up 3.05 points at 2,053.99 after touching a high of 2,072.07.
Market volume was 138.35 million shares with gainers beating losers by 283 to 90.
"The buying was pretty broad-based. But this is just better sentiment and liquidity which can dry up quickly," said a broker from a Japanese firm.
Dealers had mixed expectations on whether the Fed would raise rates.

Foreign tranches of banks OCBC, DBS and UOB rose between Singapore $0.60 and S$0.30 each. CityDev and Keppel Land closed up while electronics stock Wong's Circuits rose S$0.05 to S$1.79 on two million units.
HK Land topped actives with 9.3 million shares, up US$0.22 to US$2.69 on the back of a rally in Hong Kong.-J.Ng 65-8703094
